abstract: While the revised bankruptcy plan will give shareholders 1 percent of Dynegy, some shareholders (along with the United States government) are objecting to provisions that would release management, directors and shareholders from legal liability.
snippet: While the revised bankruptcy plan will give shareholders 1 percent of Dynegy, some shareholders (along with the United States government) are objecting to provisions that would release management, directors and shareholders from legal liability.
lead_paragraph: Dynegy’s controlling shareholders, led by Carl C. Icahn, entered Chapter 11 with a roar, but they are about to leave rather meekly.

headline.main: In Exit, Dynegy Shareholders Look to Eke Out Something
